Courses.Name: MME 2200S - ENGINEERING SHOP SAFETY TRN
Description: This course will provide mechanical engineering undergraduate students with consistent and appropriate training in the safe use of Engineering student shops.
Antirequisite(s): MSE 2200Q/R/S/T.
Extra Information: Non-credit course.

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Entry into Year 2 of the Mechanical Engineering program.

Courses.Name: MME 2202A - MECHANICS OF MATERIALS
Description: Stress and strain, Mohr's stress circle, behaviour of structures, axial loading of columns and struts, torsion of shafts, bending of beams, buckling of columns and combined loading of components.
Antirequisite(s): CEE 2202A/B, MSE 2212A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours, 0.5 laboratory hour

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1022A/B/Y, Applied Mathematics 1414A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1022A/B/Y, Applied Mathematics 1414A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1022A/B/Y, Applied Mathematics 1414A/B.

Courses.Name: MME 2204A - THERMODYNAMICS I
Description: Properties of a pure substance, first law of thermodynamics, processes in open and closed systems, second law of thermodynamics; ideal gases, compressors and energy conversion systems.
Antirequisite(s): CBE 2214A/B, MSE 2214A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours, 0.5 laboratory hour

Notes: RESTRICTED TO MECHANICAL OR INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO MECHANICAL OR INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO MECHANICAL OR INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: MME 2213B - ENGINEERING DYNAMICS
Description: Topics include: rectilinear, angular and curvilinear motion; kinetics of a particle, a translating rigid body and a rigid body in pure rotation; definitions of different energies and energy balance: power and efficiency; and linear impulse and momentum.
Antirequisite(s): MSE 2213A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours

Notes: RESTRICTED TO MECHANICAL OR YR 3 INTEGRATED OR YR 2 & 3 INTEGRATED/HBA ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO MECHANICAL OR YR 3 INTEGRATED OR YR 2 & 3 INTEGRATED/HBA ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO MECHANICAL OR YR 3 INTEGRATED OR YR 2 & 3 INTEGRATED/HBA ENGINEERING STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: MME 2221B - COMPUTATIONAL METHODS
Description: The objective of this course is to introduce data organization and processing techniques using spreadsheet tools; and numerical methods, model formulation and programming using advanced mathematical software tools. Applications in applied mathematics and mechanical engineering will be considered throughout the course.
Antirequisite(s): CEE 2219A/B, CBE 2291A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours.

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ES 1036A/B, Applied Mathematics 1411A/B, Applied Mathematics 1414A/B.
Corequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B or Applied Mathematics 2276A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ES 1036A/B, Applied Mathematics 1411A/B, Applied Mathematics 1414A/B.
Corequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B or Applied Mathematics 2276A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ES 1036A/B, Applied Mathematics 1411A/B, Applied Mathematics 1414A/B.
Corequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B or Applied Mathematics 2276A/B.

Courses.Name: MME 2234B - HEAT TRANSFER AND DYNAMICS
Description: To provide the student with an understanding of the basic concepts of heat transfer and the dynamics of particles and rigid bodies.
Antirequisite(s): MME 2204A/B, CBE 2214A/B, MME 2213A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 3 tutorial hours.
Note: Restricted to students enrolled in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO ELECTRICAL AND COMPUTER  ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO ELECTRICAL AND COMPUTER  ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO ELECTRICAL AND COMPUTER  ENGINEERING STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: MME 2259A - PRODUCT DESIGN & DEVELOPMENT
Description: Introduction to the engineering design and structured design methods. Topics include: mechanical design process; concept generation and evaluation; embodiment design; design for manufacture and assembly; design for product safety; principles of life-cycle engineering.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 3 laboratory  hours

Notes: RESTRICTED TO MECHANICAL OR YR 2  INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1021A/B, Engineering Science 1022A/B/Y, Engineering Science 1050
RESTRICTED TO MECHANICAL OR YR 2  INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1021A/B, Engineering Science 1022A/B/Y, Engineering Science 1050
RESTRICTED TO MECHANICAL OR YR 2  INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1021A/B, Engineering Science 1022A/B/Y, Engineering Science 1050

Courses.Name: MME 2260A - INDUSTRIAL MATERIALS
Description: The principles and practice of shaping and strengthening industrial materials.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 3 laboratory/tutorial hours

Courses.Name: MME 2273B - INTRO TO FLUID MECH & HEAT TRN
Description: An introduction to fluid mechanics and heat transfer. The fluid mechanics covers fluid properties, fluid statics including buoyancy and stability, one-dimensional fluid dynamics including conservation of mass and energy and losses in pipe networks. Heat transfer covers development of the general energy equation for three dimensions and steady-state conduction in one and two dimensions.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours, 0.5 laboratory hour

Courses.Name: MME 2285B - ENGINEERING EXPERIMENTATION
Description: Measurement of physical quantities; experiment planning and design; characteristics of measurement systems; calibration, linearity, accuracy, bias and sensitivity; data acquisition systems; sampling theorem; signal conditioning; sources of errors; uncertainty analysis; data analysis techniques; systems for the measurement of displacement; velocity; acceleration; force, strain, pressure, temperature, flow rate, etc.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours/week and 3 lab hours/week (6 per term).

Notes: RESTRICTED TO MECHANICAL OR INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Corequisite(s): Statistical Sciences 2143A/B or Statistical Sciences 2141A/B.
RESTRICTED TO MECHANICAL OR INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Corequisite(s): Statistical Sciences 2143A/B or Statistical Sciences 2141A/B.
RESTRICTED TO MECHANICAL OR INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Corequisite(s): Statistical Sciences 2143A/B or Statistical Sciences 2141A/B.

Courses.Name: MME 3303A - FLUID MECHANICS II
Description: Rigid-body motion and rotation, control volume method of analysis, conservation of mass, linear and angular momentum, centrifugal pumps, potential flow, dimensional analysis, viscous flow in channels and ducts, open channel flow, laminar and turbulent boundary layers, statistical description of turbulence
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours, 0.5 laboratory hour

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 3 & 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 3 & 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 3 & 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: MME 3307B - HEAT TRANSFER II
Description: Transient heat conduction. Forced and natural convection heat transfer. Advanced radiation heat transfer, including surface properties and shape factor. Condensation and boiling heat transfer. Heat exchanger design, applications of heat transfer in Engineering Systems.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours, 0.5 laboratory hour

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): MME 2204A/B, MME 2273A/B, Applied Mathematics 3413A/B.
RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): MME 2204A/B, MME 2273A/B, Applied Mathematics 3413A/B.
RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): MME 2204A/B, MME 2273A/B, Applied Mathematics 3413A/B.

Courses.Name: MME 3325A - MECHANICAL VIBRATIONS
Description: Free and forced vibration of single-degree-of-freedom systems; viscous and coulomb damping; vibration isolation and vibration measuring instruments; modelling of multi-degree-of-freedom systems via Newton’s second law; modal analysis and modal summation method for response predictions of multi-degree-of-freedom systems; tuned mass vibration absorber; introduction to vibration of continuous systems; introduction to spectrum analysis for machinery diagnostics.
Antirequisite(s): MME 4425A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours, 2 laboratory hours/week (3 per term).

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 3 & 4 MECHANICAL AND YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 3 & 4 MECHANICAL AND YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 3 & 4 MECHANICAL AND YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: MME 3334B - THERMODYNAMICS II
Description: This course emphasizes the application of thermodynamic principles to engineering systems and problem solving. Topics covered include: sonic velocity and compressible flow through nozzles, reciprocating and rotary compressors, availability and irreversibility in systems and processes, cycles, psychometry of air conditioning, thermodynamic relations and the generalized compressiblity charts, chemical reactions and equilibrium.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours, 0.5 laboratory hour

Courses.Name: MME 3350B - SYSTEM MODELING & CONTROL
Description: Basic analytical techniques for modeling and control of dynamic systems. Solve for response as well as design controllers to shape response of systems. Applications to vibratory, thermo-fluidic, hydraulic, pneumatic and electro-mechanical systems.
Antirequisite(s): CBE 3310A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours, 0.5 laboratory hours.

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B, MME 2273A/B, MME 3381A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B, MME 2273A/B, MME 3381A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B, MME 2273A/B, MME 3381A/B.

Courses.Name: MME 3360B - FINITE ELMNT METH IN MECH ENG
Description: Linear finite element analysis using the direct equilibrium method and the principle of minimum potential energy. Focus on structural mechanics using spring and bar elements (including two-dimensional trusses), beam elements, two-dimensional plane stress/strain elements, axisymmetric elements, and isoparametric formulation. Concepts of heat transfer, fluid flow, and thermal stress also introduced.
Antirequisite(s): MSE 3360A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 laboratory, 2 tutorial hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA OR YR 3 INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1036A/B or Computer Science 1026A/B, Applied Mathematics 2270A/B, MME 2202A/B or CEE 2202A/B, MME 2204A/B, MME 2259A/B or MSE 2202A/B.
RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA OR YR 3 INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1036A/B or Computer Science 1026A/B, Applied Mathematics 2270A/B, MME 2202A/B or CEE 2202A/B, MME 2204A/B, MME 2259A/B or MSE 2202A/B.
RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA OR YR 3 INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1036A/B or Computer Science 1026A/B, Applied Mathematics 2270A/B, MME 2202A/B or CEE 2202A/B, MME 2204A/B, MME 2259A/B or MSE 2202A/B.

Courses.Name: MME 3379A - MATERIALS SELECTION
Description: Application of computer databases to materials selection. Identification of the composite property for a particular application. Case studies of materials selection using variable property emphases.
Antirequisite(s): MSE 3301A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1.5 tutorial hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA OR YRS 3 & 4 INTEGRATED OR YR 2 & 3 INTEGRATED/HBA STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s):  Engineering Science 1021A/B, MME 2202A/B or CEE 2202A/B.
RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA OR YRS 3 & 4 INTEGRATED OR YR 2 & 3 INTEGRATED/HBA STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s):  Engineering Science 1021A/B, MME 2202A/B or CEE 2202A/B.

Courses.Name: MME 3380B - MECHANICAL COMPONENTS DESIGN
Description: The objective of this course is to consider the stress analysis and design of various components of a machine, e.g. an automobile.
Antirequisite(s): MSE 3380A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 3 laboratory/tutorial hours

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 3 & 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 3 & 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 3 & 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: MME 3381A - KINEMATICS & DYNAMICS OF MACH
Description: Displacement, velocity and acceleration analysis of linkages; static and dynamic force analysis of mechanisms; balancing of reciprocating and rotating masses; special-purpose joints and mechanisms.
Antirequisite(s): MSE 3381A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours, 0.5 laboratory hour

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 3 & 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS OR YR 3 OR 4  INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 3 & 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS OR YR 3 OR 4  INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 3 & 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 2 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS OR YR 3 OR 4  INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: MME 4410 - MECHNCL & MATERIALS ENG THESIS
Description: The objective of the course is to provide students with an opportunity to investigate an engineering problem independently under the supervision of a faculty member. The student will be required to prepare an engineering thesis and deliver a public lecture. This course is directed at students considering future graduate studies.
Extra Information: 6 laboratory hours.

Notes: NO FORMAL TIME SCHEDULED. COMPLETION OF THE THIRD YEAR OF THE MECHANICAL ENGINEERING PROGRAM WITH A MINIMUM 80% AVERAGE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of the third year of the Mechanical Engineering program with a minimum 80% average.

Courses.Name: MME 4423B - INTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINES
Description: This course elaborates on the fundamentals of how the design and operation of internal combustion engines affect their performance, operation, fuel requirements and environmental impact, study of fluid flow, thermodynamics, combustion, heat transfer and friction phenomena, and fuel properties, relevant to engine power, efficiency and emissions, examination of design features and operating characteristics of different types of internal combustion engines: spark-ignition, diesel, stratified-charge, and mixed-cycle engines.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 laboratory/tutorial hours

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: MME 4428A - SEL TOPICS IN MECH ENG IV
Description: Topics of current interest in Mechanical Engineering. Topics and course outlines will be available at the time of registration.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 laboratory/tutorial hours

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS. TOPIC: INTRO TO NANOENGINEERING.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of third year of the Mechanical Engineering Program.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS. TOPIC: INTRO TO NANOENGINEERING.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of third year of the Mechanical Engineering Program.

Courses.Name: MME 4429A - NUCLEAR ENGINEERING
Description: To present an overview of nuclear engineering beginning with the fundamentals of nuclear physics and extending to the operation of nuclear reactors with special emphasis on the CANDU nuclear reactor.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours; 2 laboratory/tutorial hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS. JULY 28 RESTRICTION CHANGE: ACCESS TO YR 4 CHEMICAL AND GREEN PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of third year of the Mechanical Engineering Program.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS. JULY 28 RESTRICTION CHANGE: ACCESS TO YR 4 CHEMICAL AND GREEN PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of third year of the Mechanical Engineering Program.

Courses.Name: MME 4437A - ADVANCED CAE: SIMULATION
Description: Nonlinear structural analysis, vibration of discrete and distributed systems, kinematic and dynamic analysis, flexible mechanism analysis, nonlinear thermal analysis, fluid flow analysis, thermal fluids, multi-physics simulation, interfacing between structural, thermal and mechanism analyses.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 laboratory hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING OR YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS. ALSO HELD WED IN ACEB 1400 AND FRI IN ACEB 2415.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING OR YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS. ALSO HELD WED IN ACEB 1400 AND FRI IN ACEB 2415.

Courses.Name: MME 4450A - CONTROL SYSTEMS
Description: Modern Control techniques for solving vibration and control problems associated with practical mechanical systems. The emphasis of the course is on the concepts, applications and numerical simulations to aid Power-train dynamics, Hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) simulations and communications.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: MME 4452B - ROBOTICS & MANUFACTRNG AUTOMTN
Description: An overview of robotics and manufacturing automation technology and principles. Topics include: automatic production and assembly, sensors, actuators and drives, mechanization of part handling, industrial robots, and machine vision systems. Emphasis will be on the planning, design and implementation of automation systems. PLCs will be used in the lab section.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 laboratory hours

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL, ELECTRICAL, COMPUTER, INTEGRATED ENGINEERING AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 3374A/B, MME 3380A/B, or ECE 3330A/B, ECE 3375A/B, or registration in fourth year of the Integrated Engineering program

Courses.Name: MME 4453B - CORROSION AND WEAR
Description: Corrosion principles, types of corrosion, corrosion protection. Surface characterization. Friction, lubrication and wear. Materials selection for tribological applications.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: MME 4459B - ADV CAE: MANUFACTURING TECH
Description: This course is an introduction to modern computer aided manufacturing technologies. Topics include subtractive technologies, such as computer-numerically controlled (CNC) machining, as well as additive technologies used
for rapid prototyping purposes.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours, 2 laboratory/tutorial hours

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL OR MECHATRONICS SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL OR MECHATRONICS SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

Courses.Name: MME 4460B - HEATING, VENTILATING & AC II
Description: Design of air distribution components and systems; fan/pump laws; air quality and ventilation; hot water heating systems; steam heating systems; cooling equipment; heat generation and transfer equipment; building automation controls; operations and maintenance.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: MME 4469B - BIOMECHNCS OF MUSCULOSKEL SYS
Description: Application of fundamental principles of engineering to the analysis of the human musculoskeletal system. Bone and soft tissue biomechanics, joint mechanics and kinematics, joint replacement with implants, with special interest in design of these systems; biomaterials and wear. Joints studied will include the elbow, hip, shoulder and knee.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL OR MECHATRONIC SYSTEMS OR YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA  STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): One of MME 2202A/B or MSE 2212A/B and one of MME 3380A/B or MSE 3380A/B, or enrollment in the Biomedical Engineering program.

Courses.Name: MME 4470B - MEDICAL AND ASSISTIVE DEVICES
Description: Introduction to the design, development and operation of medical and assistive devices that can improve the quality of human life. Topics include: design of assistive, corrective, and diagnostic devices; human factors engineering; biocompatibility of materials; bioelectronics; biosensors; and lab-on-a-chip systems.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours, 2 laboratory hours per week

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL OR INTEGRATED OR MECHATRONICS SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of the third year of the Mechanical Engineering or Integrated Engineering or Mechatronic Systems Engineering programs.

Courses.Name: MME 4475A - SEL TOP IN MECH ENGINEERNG II
Description: Topics of current interest in Mechanical Engineering. Topics and course outlines will be available at the time of registration.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 laboratory/tutorial hours

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS. TOPIC: ADVANCED CAE: COMPUTATIONAL HEAT & FLUID FLOW
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of third year of the Mechanical Engineering Program.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS. TOPIC: ADVANCED CAE: COMPUTATIONAL HEAT & FLUID FLOW
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of third year of the Mechanical Engineering Program.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS. TOPIC: ADVANCED CAE: COMPUTATIONAL HEAT & FLUID FLOW
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of third year of the Mechanical Engineering Program.

Courses.Name: MME 4480A - ADV CAE: REVERSE ENGINEERING
Description: This course is an introduction to the use of modern computer-aided design (CAD) techniques in generation of 3D digital models from physical objects. Topics include contact and non-contact data acquisition techniques,
data type and exchange formats, and advanced visualization and surfacing techniques.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 laboratory hours

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL OR MECHATRONICS SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL OR MECHATRONICS SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL OR MECHATRONICS SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: MME 4483A - HEATING, VENTILATING & AC
Description: The psychrometry of air conditioning processes, comfort and inside design conditions, climate and outside design conditions, heat gains from solar and other sources, cooling load and heating load calculations, ventilation and filtration.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: MME 4485A - FLUID MACHINERY
Description: Fluid turbo-machinery theory, performance characteristics of centrifugal and axial flow fans, compressors, pumps and turbines, fluid vibrations and sound, water hammer, introduction to fluid power controls and fluid amplifiers.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 laboratory hour, 1 tutorial hour

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: MME 4487A - MECHATRONIC SYSTEM DESIGN
Description: An overview of electrical, mechanical, optical and control technologies for system integration. Topics include: intelligent products and processes; design methodology; system modeling; sensors and actuators; microcontrollers; knowledge-based control.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours, 3 laboratory hours

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL, ELECTRICAL, COMPUTER OR INTEGRATED OR YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS, INTEGRATED/HBA ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): MME 2213A/B or MME 2234A/B, and ECE 3374A/B, or (ECE 2233A/B and ECE 2277A/B), or (ECE 2238A/B and ECE 2277A/B).

Courses.Name: MME 4490B - ADVANCED MANUFACTURING
Description: The course focuses on advanced manufacturing topics such as enhanced product development, modeling, and fabrication techniques as well as the emerging Industry 4.0 concept. The international context of the course is expected to strengthen students' skill and understanding of manufacturing, as performed in a global and interconnected economy.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours per week, 1 laboratory hour per week.

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Enrolment in the third year of the Mechanical, Mechatronic or Integrated

Courses.Name: MME 4492B - PRODUCTION MGMT FOR ENGINEERS
Description: This course examines lean production principles and practices adopted by world-class manufacturers. Topics include: continuous improvement; total quality management; statistical process control; setup reduction; total productive maintenance; just-in-time and pull production; group technology; cellular manufacturing; standard operations; level production scheduling; process balancing; supply chain management; activitiy based costing; agile manufacturing.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 laboratory/tutorial hours

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL OR INTEGRATED OR MECHATRONICS SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS AND YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: MME 4499 - MECH ENG DESIGN PROJECT
Description: Students develop and practice engineering design skills by working on a team-based project. The students will experience all phases of the design process, including: problem definition, generation and evaluation of concepts,engineering analysis and testing, and preparation of design documentation. Project management and communications skills are emphasized.
Antirequisite(s): CBE 4497, CEE 4441, ECE 4416, SE 4450, ES 4499.
Extra Information: 1 lecture hours, 4 laboratory/tutorial hours

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 MECHANICAL OR YR 3 MECHANICAL/HBA  STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of the third year of the Mechanical Engineering program.
